intro: Crotalaria peguana var. qiubeiensis, commonly known as the Qiubei crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan Province. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. It is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
